snippet: Hailed as the 21st century’s answer to Proust for his controversial six-volume autobiographical work, “My Struggle,” Karl Ove Knausgaard responds to his sudden celebrity with this essay on his tortured relationship with fame — its intense...
abstract: Scandinavian writer Karl Ove Knausgaard shares details of his early struggle to be unique within a culture that values uniformity in his six-volume autobiographical series My Struggle.

byline.original: By KARL OVE KNAUSGAARD and INGVILD BURKEY

lead_paragraph: Hailed as the 21st century’s answer to Proust for his controversial six-volume autobiographical work, “My Struggle,” Karl Ove Knausgaard responds to his sudden celebrity with this essay on his tortured relationship with fame — its intense lure, its perils and the Scandinavian culture that condemns its pursuit.

headline.main: I Am Someone, Look at Me
